Pre-Game Insights: Willy Sagnol's men may be the underdogs for this clash but you best believe they will back themselves to get something from it.
Czechia did not offer a great deal in their last-gasp defeat to Portugal and are now without a clean sheet in five matches.
Georgia fans will have been proud of what they saw during a truly enthralling contest, one of the best of the tournament so far.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Saturday’s clash will mark the first-ever coming together of these two nations.
Czechia’s defeat to Portugal was only their second time tasting defeat in their last 15 matches.
Georgia is more familiar with the taste of defeat (six in the last 15), but half of these have been against strong opposition, namely Spain (twice) and Morocco.
Others: The game will be accessible via 1TV (aka First Channel) in Georgia, while in Czechia, viewers can watch live via Česká Televize (CT) Sport.
In the UK, BBC One is the channel you need.

Prediction: It was hard not to be impressed by a plucky Georgian side in their Group F opener with Turkiye. The Jvarosnebi played without fear and with a similar mindset; they should find the back of the net against a Czechia side struggling for clean sheets.
